topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
I had a interesting thought:
Have you ever wondered why we don't have real life superheroes like Ironman or such?  Easy: metal helmet.  If someone with enough money were to drop tens of billions of dollars on such a suit all you would need to do is use a bunch of thick ass oven mits to grab a lose electric cable then shock them in the head (please don't grab electric cables); the electricity would roll around in the person's body and catch their hair on fire and potentially explode the person's head inside the suit like a watermelon being exploded by a fire cracker.

Even a tazer could take the person out; just smack them in the head with a tazer and having a thousand volts roll around in their brain wouldn't kill them but it would send them to the emergency room with the person convulsing on the floor.

Tl:dr; metal helmet + electricity = bad idea

It's also why we don't have power armor like in Fallout.
